newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Yeltsin sets investor rights commission,depository.
newsitem.headline: Yeltsin sets investor rights commission,depository.

text.p: President Boris Yeltsin ordered a commission to protect investor rights and a national depository to be set up, local agencies quoted him as saying on Wednesday.

The plans for a national depository, drawn up by the Finance Ministry, the central bank and securities market watchdog the Federal Commission on the Securities Market, will abolish separate depositories for government securities and shares.
It was not clear whether Yeltsin has approved this particular idea as texts of the decrees were not immediately available.
The lack of western-style investor rights protection has deterred many foreign investors from channelling funds into Russia's often unruly emerging markets.
But recently courts and the government have acted to defend the rights of minority shareholders.
